channel.title: Comments on: Formatting the time from a datetime or time datatype by using the STUFF function
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Kevin Rowe
item.dc:creator: Kevin Rowe
item.description: Thanks for the information. I expected this to be much more difficult. BTW, using 2005 and all of my times are working correctly with just: <blockquote>STUFF(RIGHT(CONVERT(VARCHAR, [Start], 100), 7),6,0,' ') AS StartTime</blockquote>.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the information. I expected this to be much more difficult. BTW, using 2005 and all of my times are working correctly with just:

STUFF(RIGHT(CONVERT(VARCHAR, [Start], 100), 7),6,0,’ ‘) AS StartTime

.

item.title: By: FoxyHunter
item.dc:creator: FoxyHunter
item.description:
Hi
Could you help me, I want convert this column(sndtime) just time but I can't this is code that I'm using.
Code LTRIM(STUFF(RIGHT(CONVERT(VARCHAR(30),tsd.sndTime,100),7),6,0,)) AS [Scan Time]
sndTime 1900-01-01 22:36:00.000
item.content:encoded:
Hi

Could you help me, I want convert this column(sndtime) just time but I can’t this is code that I’m using.

Code
LTRIM(STUFF(RIGHT(CONVERT(VARCHAR(30),tsd.sndTime,100),7),6,0,)) AS [Scan Time]

sndTime
1900-01-01 22:36:00.000

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Yes, you are right, can you tell I only have 2008 instances üôÇ

I have fixed it

item.title: By: ca8msm
item.dc:creator: ca8msm
item.content:encoded:
“Okay but what if you are not on SQL Server 2008? No problem really, it is almost the same”

Denis, you’ll need to amend your first line to not set the value “inline” as well otherwise you’ll get the “cannot assign a default value to a local variable” error.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Thanks Brad, I will modify the code...I could have sworn I tested with that :-(
item.content:encoded: Thanks Brad, I will modify the code…I could have sworn I tested with that üôÅ

item.title: By: bradschu
item.dc:creator: bradschu
item.content:encoded:
I’m afraid the approach will only work for times up to 9:59:59 AM/PM. Once you get into 2-digit hours (10, 11 or 12), then the function will break, I’m afraid. (For a time of 10:00:00, it will show ‘0:00 AM’, cutting off the left-most digit).

Instead of RIGHT(,6), I would instead to RIGHT(,7) and then LTRIM() it at the end. You’ll also have to change the location of the STUFF(). Here’s what I suggest:

SELECT LTRIM(STUFF(RIGHT(CONVERT(VARCHAR(30),@d,100),7),6,0,’ ‘))

–Brad
